snippet.title: Police raids uncover dozens of Coast crimes
snippet.content: ALMOST a dozen people have been busted for drug and property crimes after a string of Coast police raids over recent weeks. Kawana Waters Police, along with the Sunshine Coast District Tactical Crime Squad, undertook 10 search warrants on homes in Wurtulla, Warana, Buddina, Aroona, Currimundi and Little Mountain, resulting in 11 offenders being charged with 29 drug and property-related offences. Officer in Charge of Kawana Waters Police Station, Senior Sergeant Mark Cordwell said the public played a pivotal role in catching the offenders. "Significant information was provided by members of the public, which greatly assisted police in identifying suspect persons and addresses and, ultimately, in taking this enforcement action," Snr Sgt Cordwell said. "This assistance is appreciated and helps police in detecting those people involved in drug activity." All offenders will face court in coming weeks.
